title: Is it okay to mix tenses if you are writing in first person? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. But sometimes. But mostly no. The other answer is correct. People think in present tense, so you can always put thoughts is present tense, like so: I'm gonna die, Joe thought. Goddammit, I'm gonna die! ‘I'm’ is present tense. ‘Thought’ is past. But in your mind, you hardly say I was going to die. Thats just not what people do. But. But, for the love of god, do not mix narration tenses. They are looking at their actions either from the future or from the present, not both. They are Katniss, narrating the Hunger Games as they happen, or they are Kvothe, looking at events from long ago. If you want two distinct time periods, then you can switch it up, but only within the limits of those times. For example. Now I am here. But it was a long road, a rough road. Let me tell you about my birth. No. Too long ago. Let me tell you about my childhood. I was a poor kid from a poor home . . . Two times. Now and the past. Everything you experience now is current, present, happening. Use ‘I am.’ In the past, it already happened. Use ‘I was.’ If you're asking this question, stick with one tense. I assume you don't know when your character is speaking from, so don't make it too elaborate in the first draft. One tense and one tense only. You can add others later. There is nothing that annoys me more than a tense that changes while I read. Except perhaps comma splices. Just don't do it. Please. Thank you.

The entirety of my novel, Johnny Outlaw, is told from Johnny’s perspective. All of the actions are written in past tense and all of his thoughts are written in present tense. Here is an excerpt from chapter 6 Empty Inside to show you how I combine the two tenses.  I put some warm water on my face and ran the blade across my face. It took awhile but all the facial hair was gone. I took the comb and tried to decide what to do with my hair. I ran the comb through my hair and styled it back, and felt something familiar tugging at my mind. Maybe now that I had cleaned up… maybe I could remember who I was. I looked into the mirror and stared at the reflection “My name is…okay let’s try this again my name” I curled my fists. “My name is! Dammit come on…” I gritted my teeth “My name is” I felt tears well up and I hit the wall “Come on Dammit! My name is…” I stared back at my reflection and I couldn’t take it “My name is… My name is…” My throat got drier and the tears ran down my face, “My name…” I sighed “My… my…I… I don’t know.” Why can’t I know? Please, someone help me. I feel so alone, this is worse than everything that’s happened so far, I thought a shave would help me remember. When I first cried it was because I was angry that I didn’t know who I was, then I cried because I was afraid of what I might be, but this...I’m broken. This pain is so much worse, it’s not like any of the wounds before, I’m a shell. I’m nothing. I walked to the bed and fell down on it, I couldn’t handle this; this is hell. Hell isn’t physical pain, it’s an emptiness inside that starts to consume you. God, could someone please tell me who I am.
